content: in this legal case there was a coownership property identified as parcel number 9217 the court has dissolved the coownership and transferred the property entirely to petitioner b m the petitioner has been ordered to pay the value of the coowners share to the counterparty r h within 15 days once the payment is made the counterparty will have a lien on the property the land registry department will register the right of ownership and the lien as instructed by the court the court used specific legal principles in making this decision the petitioner owns the majority of shares in the property and proposed the dissolution of the coownership an expert report was prepared to determine the market value of the property which was considered complete and objective by the court the court is bound by legal provisions in dissolving the coownership but can also consider valid agreements between the parties the petitioner will receive the entire property and will compensate the counterparty with a specified amount the counterparty will retain a lien on the property until the payment is made
